noun.description: In Spanish poetry: a stanza of rhyming verse; specifically (in early use) = "rondeau"; (in later use) a stanza of four trochaic lines of six or eight syllables, in which the first line rhymes with the fourth, and the second with the third.

origin: Early 18th century. From Spanish redondilla from redondo round + -illa, after French rondeau or one of its cognates.
